Most of the fanbase doesn't realize the kind of champions that are picked in the LCS. There are certain aspects that champions must have in order to be picked.

The biggest thing is range vs melee.
If a champion is ranged, then it's almost always a carry champion. Mostly, an ADC or a Mage. (Enchanters supports also exist here). Generally, they are squishy, but they have the ability to provide insane damage and most of the team comp revolves around them.

Melee champions are quite more complex though. Since being melee means that you put yourself in danger in order to deal damage, most of the time you want tanky champions. Also, a tank champion on its own isn't enough, you need that champion to be able to do something active, rather than being just a meatshield. So, for example, Mundo is useless, because he's just a meatshield. That's why you pick tanks you have a lot of CC, engage, interrupts etc. Sion has a lot of that, Ornn, Maokai, Chogath have quite a lot, while also being extremely tanky and have some damage.

So, you either pick CC melee tanks, and high DPS ranged characters. That's the basic philosophy. Sure, you see top lane carries like Fiora, or Jungle carries like KhaZIx. 

Having some way to assist the team with a semi-global ability also is a huge thing. That's why things like Galio, Sion, Taliyah and Ryze are so contested picks.

I've literally played a game where the introduction of an assassin class eliminated almost all open world pvp because nobody was having fun getting 100-0 from stealth, back to stealth. People would just rather not PvP at all, and the MAIN APPEAL of the entire game was open PvP!

If you have to miss every cannon, then the problem isn't the assassin, but your positioning and game knowledge, and maybe itemization. Manipulate waves better and stand on the side of the map closest to your jungler. Position yourself so that the assassin cannot effectively reach you and zone the assassin at the same time. If you are unable to zone the assassin (for example: hard counter or already behind) you should just focus on farming and juking skills anyways, and in which case you should not be complaining because a champion that is behind should not be able to contest one that is supposed to snowball when ahead. Stand by the wave so that the minions will aggro if the assassin tries to engage. Understand power curves of the assassin you are playing against. For example: Zed has weak pre 6 against most mages, then has a lot of kill pressure for the rest of laning phase unless playing against a counter, who slightly lowers his kill pressure. Talon has incredible level 2 and level 3, and will do a ton of damage early on, and slightly fall off later. If you still have a ton of trouble, don't be afraid to take resolve secondary, or grab a cloth armor/null magic mantle/extra starting item, or even ninja tabi/armguard/negatron cloak if applicable

Keep in mind that assassins only stomp players who are bad at the game. If you don't respect their damage early, they lose their effectiveness and utility later. A good player (or team, if the assassin is a jungler) can completely shut down an assassin. See: the dopa video where he beat Fizz in lane as TF

This means that sometimes, you have take to risky plays in order to get ahead, especially if the team is falling behind, in an attempt to salvage some games. Guess what though. A late-game scaling mage like Viktor won't have much success in making lots of plays versus someone like a Zed who can all-in someone and kill them most of the time.

Patience goes out of the window here, you can't just sit there and wait to scale up and hoping you don't already lose in the process.

The other bad part of their design in general is how they snowball extremely hard off just building part of 1 item. Kat - LB hex, Yas Zeal, Fizz Sheen, and Kas any part of his roa, Zed his poachers.

The other annoying thing is that each of those champs have a ton of mobility and can easily dodge skill shots while also having no real resource management needed. Plus some of these champs even get shields or short CDs on their "get out of jail free" skill.

Riot wants to nerf mages who can't even take towers nearly as fast as any other role ( minus the small exception like Azir as an example. ) They claim it's to help with the upcoming ADC changes, but that is just a stupid thought process to work off of. You want to nerf a role entirely so that you can then nerf another role after? How about putting in the QOL changes that ADCs need on their itemizations and ratios. How about just entirly doing away with crit finally or putting a cap on it? It's honestly not fun to watch an ADC "skill" or right click just to win a fight. There is literally no punishment to the role at this time because they are super safe with their items giving lots of mobility, boosted range, health, shields, aspd, on top of that stupid 1-2k crit dmg. It's time to admit there is a real problem and address it riot. If I can keep my adc alive for just a few seconds and cc their adc, we win instantly. ( I got so sick of support the last 2 seasons I'm started going into JG and Mid more because everything is about just getting bot lane the win. )
